books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: a novel by the Russian author, first published in book form in 1878. Many writers consider Anna Karenina the greatest work of literature ever, and Tolstoy himself called it his first true novel.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: the story of one beautiful, innocent young man's seduction, moral corruption, and eventual downfall.

books.title: The Plague
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: tells the story of a plague sweeping the French Algerian city of Oran. It asks a number of questions relating to the nature of destiny and the human condition. The characters in the book, ranging from doctors to vacationers to fugitives, all help to show the effects the plague has on a populace.

books.title: Night
books.author: Elie Wiesel
books.description: the author's experience with his father in the Nazi German concentration camps at Auschwitz and Buchenwald in 1944â€“1945, at the height of the Holocaust toward the end of the Second World War.

books.title: Vogue
books.description: fashion and lifestyle magazine covering many topics including fashion, beauty, culture, living, and runway.

books.title: Cosmopolitan
books.description: monthly magazine for women, with more than 50 international editions. The advertisement-heavy magazine features short fiction pieces and advice-oriented articles on relationships, sex, fashion, entertainment, and careers.

books.title: Harry Potter the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione deduce that the treasure under the trapdoor is the Philosopher's Stone, which can transform metal into gold and can also confer immortality. They later discover that Voldemort has been killing unicorns in the Forbidden Forest and drinking their blood, another way to achieve immortality.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Pride and Prejudice, romantic novel by Jane Austen, published anonymously in three volumes in 1813. A classic of English literature, written with incisive wit and superb character delineation, it centres on the turbulent relationship between Elizabeth Bennet, the daughter of a country gentleman, and Fitzwilliam Darcy, a rich aristocratic landowner.
